translations: n.工会会员；工会主义者；统一主义者，统一派（尤其主张北爱尔兰继续为英国的一部分）（Unionist）；（美国南北战争时期）联邦主义者（Unionist）
adj.统一主义者的，统一主义的（Unionist）

sentences.sentence: The Unionist parties boycotted the conference because Adams was coming.
sentences.translation: 由于亚当斯的到来，统一党抵制了举行这个和平会议。

sentences.sentence: Separate votes for each community might have produced blockage on the Unionist side.
sentences.translation: 各个社区的单独投票可能给两面派带来了难处。

sentences.sentence: Brian Faulkner, a hardline Unionist who had become the Prime Minister of N.I. in March 1971, wanted even stronger security measures.
sentences.translation: 1971年3月，强硬联合派布莱恩·福克纳(Brian Faulkner)成为北爱首相，期望采取更强硬保安措施。
